title: 1663-E
statement: E. Are You Safe?time limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputSeven boys and seven girls from Athens were brought before King Minos. The evil king laughed and said "I hope you enjoy your stay in Crete".With a loud clang, the doors behind them shut, and darkness reigned. The terrified children huddled together. In the distance they heard a bellowing, unholy roar.Bravely, they advanced forward, to their doom.Input$$$n$$$ ($$$1 \\le n \\le 100$$$) â€” the dimensions of the labyrinth.Each of the next $$$n$$$ lines contains a string of lowercase English letters of length $$$n$$$.ExampleInput10 atzxcodera mzhappyayc mineodteri trxesonaac mtollexcxc hjikeoutlc eascripsni rgvymnjcxm onzazwswwg geothermalOutputYES

processed.result:
Given a square grid of size $n \times n$ where each cell contains a lowercase English letter, determine if there is a path from the top left corner to the bottom right corner using only horizontal and vertical movements. 

Input:

* $n$ - the size of the grid ($1 \le n \le 100$)
* $n$ lines, each containing a string of $n$ lowercase English letters representing the grid.

Output:

* "YES" if a path exists, "NO" otherwise.
Given a square grid of letters, determine if a specific word can be found within the grid.
